snippet: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein said airstrikes by the Saudi-led coalition and the shelling of civilian targets by the Houthis and their affiliated forces could amount to war crimes.
abstract: United Nations Human Rights chief asks for independent investigation into human rights violations in Yemen caused by conflict between Saudi-led coalition and Houthi-led rebellion; reports over 2,000 civilian deaths and 4,000 others wounded so far conflict, leaving 21 million or 80 percent of population in need of humanitarian aid.
lead_paragraph: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein said airstrikes by the Saudi-led coalition and the shelling of civilian targets by the Houthis and their affiliated forces could amount to war crimes.

headline.main: U.N. Human Rights Chief Calls for Independent Inquiry on Yemen
headline.print_headline: U.N. Human Rights Chief Calls for Inquiry in Yemen

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
